item.title: Schumer plans to bring two major kids online safety bills to the Senate floor this week
item.description:
Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) plans to announce in a speech that he will bring the Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA) and the Children’s and Teens Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA 2.0) to the Senate floor this week for a procedural vote. This tees up the biggest step yet on the federal level to move forward with a law in the area of kids' online safety legislation.

“Over the past few months I’ve met with families from across the country who have gone through the worst thing a parent could endure – losing a child,” Schumer said in a statement. “Rather than retreating into the darkness of their loss, these families lit a candle for others with their advocacy. I am proud to work side-by-side with them and put on the floor...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Lauren Feiner

item.title: Kamala Harris to skip Netanyahu's address to Congress; 'disappointing', say Israeli officials
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris chooses not to preside over Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's Congress address but plans to meet with him separately. Harris will reaffirm US support for Israel's security and discuss ceasefire strategies. Session to be presided over by Senator Ben Cardin in Harris' absence.

item.title: When JD Vance called Kamala Harris 'childless cat lady'
item.description: ​Donald Trump's VP pick JD Vance is being trashed on social media as his old video calling Kamala Harris a childless cat lady has surfaced and going viral. The video is from 2022 -- from an interview that the Ohio senator gave to the Fox News as he condemned the left-liberals.

item.title: Scores arrested in Uganda at banned rally inspired by Kenya protests
item.description:
Police in Kampala stop and detain anti-corruption demonstrators after earlier round-up of opposition MPs

Scores of demonstrators have been arrested in the Uganda capital, Kampala, for taking part in a banned rally that has drawn inspiration from the youth-led anti-government protests that have roiled neighbouring Kenya for a month now.

Police stopped and detained people from among small groups of protesters that were marching and shouting anti-corruption slogans in different parts of the city.

Continue reading...

item.title: US election live updates: top congressional Democrats to endorse Kamala Harris – report
item.description:
Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer and House minority leader Hakeem Jeffries to endorse Kamala Harris at press conference today, Politico reports

  • Who might Kamala Harris pick for VP? Three favorites emerge
  • Kamala Harris races towards 2024 nomination after whirlwind start

Harris will not preside over the chamber when when Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addresses a joint meeting of Congress on Wednesday.

According to an aide, she will meet with Netanyahu at the White House at some point this week. On Wednesday, Harris is scheduled to be in Indianapolis to moderate a conversation with the Zeta Phi Beta sorority, Inc, one of the nation’s oldest Black sororities.

Continue reading...

item.title: Secret Service chief Kimberly Cheatle quits after Trump assassination attempt
item.description:
Cheatle steps down a day after House hearing where members of both parties called for her to quit

  • US election – live updates

The director of the US Secret Service, Kimberly Cheatle, has resigned just a day after a contentious House hearing where members of both parties called for her to quit her job in the wake of the assassination attempt against Donald Trump at a Pennsylvania rally.

Cheatle, who had served as Secret Service director since August 2022, had called the attempt on Trump’s life the Secret Service’s “most significant operational failure” in decades.

Continue reading...
